verse_text: And when he had descended from the mountain, great crowds followed him
And behold, a leper, drawing near, adored him, saying, â€œLord, if you are willing, you are able to cleanse me.
And Jesus, extending his hand, touched him, saying: â€œI am willing. Be cleansed.â€ And immediately his leprosy was cleansed
And Jesus said to him: â€œSee to it that you tell no one. But go, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses instructed, as a testimony for them.
And when he had entered into Capernaum, a centurion approached, petitioning him
and saying, â€œLord, my servant lies at home paralyzed and badly tormented.
And Jesus said to him, â€œI will come and heal him.
And responding, the centurion said: â€œLord, I am not worthy that you should enter under my roof, but only say the word, and my servant shall be healed

For I, too, am a man placed under authority, having soldiers under me. And I say to one, â€˜Go,â€™ and he goes, and to another, â€˜Come,â€™ and he comes, and to my servant, â€˜Do this,â€™ and he does it.
And, hearing this, Jesus wondered. And he said to those following him: â€œAmen I say to you, I have not found so great a faith in Israel
For I say to you, that many shall come from the east and the west, and they shall sit at table with Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven
But the sons of the kingdom shall be cast into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
And Jesus said to the centurion, â€œGo, and just as you have believed, so let it be done for you.â€ And the servant was healed at that very hour
And when Jesus had arrived at the house of Peter, he saw his mother-in-law lying ill with a fever
And he touched her hand, and the fever left her, and she rose up and ministered to them
And when evening arrived, they brought to him many who had demons, and he cast out the spirits with a word. And he healed all those having maladies
in order to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah, saying, â€œHe took our infirmities, and he carried away our diseases.
Then Jesus, seeing the great crowds encircling him, gave orders to go across the sea
And one scribe, approaching, said to him, â€œTeacher, I will follow you wherever you will go.
And Jesus said to him, â€œFoxes have dens, and the birds of the air have nests, but the Son of man has nowhere to rest his head.
Then another of his disciples said to him, â€œLord, permit me first to go and bury my father.
But Jesus said to him, â€œFollow me, and allow the dead to bury their dead.
And climbing into a boat, his disciples followed him
And behold, a great tempest occurred in the sea, so much so that the boat was covered with waves; yet truly, he was sleeping
And his disciples drew near to him, and they awakened him, saying: â€œLord, save us, we are perishing.
And Jesus said to them, â€œWhy are you afraid, O little in faith?â€ Then rising up, he commanded the winds, and the sea. And a great tranquility occurred
Moreover, the men wondered, saying: â€œWhat kind of man is this? For even the winds and the sea obey him.

And when he had arrived across the sea, into the region of the Gerasenes, he was met by two who had demons, who were so exceedingly savage, as they went out from among the tombs, that no one was able to cross by that way
And behold, they cried out, saying: â€œWhat are we to you, O Jesus, the Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?
Now there was, not far from them, a herd of many swine feeding
Then the demons petitioned him, saying: â€œIf you cast us from here, send us into the herd of swine.
And he said to them, â€œGo.â€ And they, going out, went into the swine. And behold, the entire herd suddenly rushed along a steep place into the sea. And they died in the waters
Then the shepherds fled, and arriving in the city, they reported on all this, and on those who had had the demons
And behold, the entire city went out to meet Jesus. And having seen him, they petitioned him, so that he would cross from their borders
